content.question:
<math alttext="2 H 2 O 2, aqueous, reacts to produce 2 H 2 O, liquid, plus O 2, gas. delta G naught, equals negative 234 kilojoules per mole reaction." overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace></mrow><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>−</mo><mn>234</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>J/</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>o</mtext><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></math>

The value of <math alttext="delta G naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction represented above implies that the decomposition of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is thermodynamically favorable. However, <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is typically stable for up to a year stored in a dark bottle at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The best explanation for this observation is that the decomposition reaction

choices.label: is only thermodynamically favorable in the presence of a catalyst

occurs with an increase in entropy because <math alttext="O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a product

is reversible and <math alttext="H 2 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is produced almost as fast as it decomposes

has a slow rate at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the activation energy is relatively high

content.answer: has a slow rate at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the activation energy is relatively high

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
